metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4439 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The esp_reg_write function in hw/scsi/esp.c in the 53C9X Fast SCSI Controller (FSC) support in QEMU does not properly check command buffer length, which allows local guest OS administrators to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds write and QEMU process crash) or potentially execute arbitrary code on the QEMU host via unspecified vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4439` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.26
qemu-common - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.26
qemu-guest-agent - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.26
qemu-keymaps - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.26
qemu-kvm - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.26
qemu-system - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.26
qemu-system-aarch64 - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.26
qemu-system-arm - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.26
qemu-system-common - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.26
qemu-system-mips - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.26
qemu-system-misc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.26
qemu-system-ppc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.26
qemu-system-sparc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.26
qemu-system-x86 - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.26
qemu-user - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.26
qemu-user-static - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.26
qemu-utils - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.26
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> qemu-kvm in precise doesn't build esp.c on Ubuntu

criterions.comment: qemu package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.26').
